content: turn heel row 1 sl1 k19 ssk k1 turn row 2 sl1 p5 p2tog p1 turn row 3 sl1 knit to one stitch before the gap ssk k1 turn row 4 sl1 purl to one stitch before the gap p2tog p1 turn repeat row 3 and 4 until all stitches have been worked the last two row will end with ssk and p2tog respectively omitting the k1 or p1 there are 20 heel stitches knit across heel stitches cut the cc gusset go back to the start of the round where you last left your mc with mc pick up one stitch at the top of the gusset then 18 sts along the edge of the heel flap knit the 20 sole sts pick up and knit 18 sts from along the edge of the heel flap pick up one more stitch at the top of the gusset to help close the gap while keeping in pattern round 9 work the instep sts gusset decrease round 1 k1 ssk knit to 3 sts before the end of the needle k2tog k1 keep in pattern while working instep sts round 2 knit all sole sts keep in pattern on instep sts repeat rounds 1 and 2 until there are 36 sole sts 72 sts total �3 foot continue working the diamond pattern on the instep sts and knitting the sole sts until foot measures 2 inches from desired length ending with either round 8 or round 16 of diamond pattern cut mc toe using the cc knit for 2 rounds round 1 *k1 ssk knit to last 3 sts on needle k2tog k1 repeat from* for second needle round 2 knit repeat rounds 1 and 2 until you have half of the original sts of your sock 36 then work round 1 every round until you have 10 sts remaining on each needle graft sts using the kitchener st sew in ends and repeat �4 © 2014 two birds knitting co please do not copy or distribute this pattern without permission from the designer email twobirdsknitting@gmail com
